text: in our previous video we went over the
top three ways to increase your
testosterone levels that video did well
so as promised I did some more research
and I'm back with two additional tips if
you have not watched the previous video
make sure to watch it after watching
this one with that being said let's Jump
Right In A study was conducted in 2021.
researchers took 19 people and had them
avoid sunlight completely for two days
on the third day the participants were
instructed to get 25 minutes of direct
sunlight in the middle of the day when
the sun shined brightest researchers
collected blood samples before and after
the third day and they discovered that
exposure to ultraviolet bee waves which
the sun produces leads to a drastic
increase in testosterone production
which is why tip number one is to make
sure that you get at least 20 minutes of
direct sunlight every day without
sunscreen the reason I bring up
sunscreen is because sunscreen is
designed to block UVB light which means
you will not get as much of a
testosterone increase if you are worried
about getting sunburned you can space
out your sun exposure throughout the day
maybe just 10 minutes during a morning
walk and another 10 minutes while you go
out on a lunch break researchers have
also found that your skin color has an
impact on how much testosterone is
produced when exposed to sunlight so if
you have darker skin you will need to
spend a slightly more time Under the Sun
to reap the same benefits tip number two
is to decrease your exposure to
endocrine disruptors what are endocrine
disruptors well simply put there are
chemicals that interfere with the
hormones in our body numerous Studies
have found that common disruptors such
as phthalates and BPA can drastically
decrease the testosterone production in
our body the problem with these
chemicals is that it's impossible to
avoid them all together as they are
present in almost everything that we use
in modern society but there are still
some things that we can do to help
decrease our overall Exposure My First
suggestion is to avoid Plastics when
eating drinking and storing things this
means using a glass cup instead of
drinking from plastic bottles using a
glass container to keep your leftovers
instead of a plastic one and avoiding
fast food which is usually wrapped in
material with tons of these chemicals
and avoiding things like disposable cups
for coffee my second suggestion is to
avoid touching thermal receipts this is
a special type of paper that is used to
print receipts movie tickets plane
tickets and sometimes even food labels
Studies have found that these pieces of
paper have up to a thousand times more
BPA in them than food and simply
touching the paper allows the chemicals
to be absorbed Through Your Skin into
your bloodstream you can test to see if
something is a thermal receipt by
scratching it and seeing if it turns
slightly black and finally I recommend
reviewing the hygiene products that you
use the majority of these products
contain endocrine disruptors and if it
says fragrance as an ingredient it
probably contains phthalates when you
apply these products to your skin many
of these chemicals are absorbed into
your bloodstream there are tons of
options out there for organic soaps and
shampoos that do not have endocrine
disrupting chemicals you'll just have to
do your own research and look for them
and that's it again if you have not
watched our previous video on three
other unique tips to increase
testosterone you can find that video by
clicking on the link in the description
box below besides that guys stay tuned
